description: This is a showcase of the various metrics provided by Backstage along with auto instrumented metrics to help setup observability for your Backstage instance!

panels.description: Displays the highest number of Backstage catalog entities grouped by their kind (e.g., Component, API, Resource) within the selected namespace. This helps monitor the scale and composition of entities managed in Backstage.
panels.title: Catalog Entities

panels.description: Displays the average delay (in seconds) experienced by the Backstage catalog processing queue over the last minute, within the selected namespace. This metric helps identify performance bottlenecks or latency issues in entity ingestion and updates.
panels.title: Catalog Processing Queue Delay

panels.description: Displays the maximum average time (in seconds) taken to process catalog entities in Backstage, grouped by result type (e.g., success, error), over the past minute within the selected namespace. This helps monitor processing performance and identify potential issues affecting ingestion outcomes.
panels.title: Catalog Processing Duration

panels.description: Displays the per-second rate of catalog entities processed in Backstage over the last 5 minutes, grouped by result type (e.g., success, failure), within the selected namespace. This metric helps monitor processing throughput and detect anomalies in ingestion outcomes.
panels.title: Catalog Processed Entities Per Second

panels.description:
Displays the maximum number of entities waiting in the Backstage catalog stitching queue, grouped by pod, within the selected namespace. This metric helps identify potential bottlenecks or uneven workload distribution across pods in the catalog processing pipeline.

_Stitching describes the process of merging and resolving entity relationships after they’ve been ingested into the catalog._
panels.title: Catalog Stitching Queue Length

panels.description:
Shows the per-second rate of stitched catalog entities in Backstage over the last 5 minutes, grouped by namespace and result type (e.g., success, failure). This metric helps monitor stitching throughput and identify issues across different namespaces.

_Stitching describes the process of merging and resolving entity relationships after they’ve been ingested into the catalog._
panels.title: Catalog Entities Stitched Per Second

panels.description:
Displays the maximum average time (in seconds) taken to stitch catalog entities in Backstage, grouped by result type (e.g., success, failure), over the past minute. This metric helps monitor stitching performance and detect anomalies or delays in catalog resolution.

_Stitching describes the process of merging and resolving entity relationships after they’ve been ingested into the catalog._
panels.title: Catalog Stitching Duration

panels.description: Displays the elapsed time (in seconds) since the last execution of each catalog backend task in Backstage, grouped by pod and task ID, within the selected namespace. This metric helps identify stale or inactive tasks that may require attention or indicate scheduling issues.
panels.title: Backend Tasks Time Since Scheduler Task Start

panels.description: Displays the most recent start time (as a Unix timestamp) for each catalog backend task in Backstage, grouped by task ID, within the selected namespace. This metric helps track task execution activity and identify tasks that may not be running as expected.
panels.title: Backend Tasks Runs Started

panels.description: Displays the most recent completion timestamp (as a Unix timestamp) for each catalog backend task in Backstage, grouped by task ID, within the selected namespace. This metric helps monitor task execution activity and identify tasks that may not be completing as expected.
panels.title: Backend Tasks Runs Completed

panels.description: Displays the maximum number of executed steps in Backstage scaffolder tasks, grouped by template and step name, within the selected namespace. This metric helps monitor usage patterns and identify which scaffolder templates and steps are most frequently run.
panels.title: Scaffolder Step Count

panels.description: Displays the maximum number of completed scaffolder tasks in Backstage, grouped by template, within the selected namespace. This metric helps track usage trends of different templates and identify which ones are most frequently used for scaffolding operations.
panels.title: Scaffolder Task Count

panels.description: Displays the proportion of HTTP requests to the Backstage service that resulted in server errors (5xx) or rate limiting (429) over the last 5 minutes, within the selected namespace. This metric helps monitor the reliability and responsiveness of the Backstage backend.
panels.title: Server request availability

panels.description: Displays the proportion of HTTP client requests made by the Backstage service that resulted in client or server errors (HTTP 4xx and 5xx) over the last 5 minutes, within the selected namespace. This metric helps monitor the reliability of outbound requests and detect issues with external service interactions.
panels.title: Client Requests Availability

panels.description: Displays the maximum average duration (in seconds) of database client operations in Backstage over the past minute, grouped by result type (e.g., success, error), within the selected namespace. This metric helps monitor database performance and identify potential issues affecting query execution times.
panels.title: DB Operation Duration

panels.description: Displays the maximum average duration (in seconds) of database client operations in Backstage over the past minute, grouped by result type (e.g., success, error) and operation name (e.g., query, insert, update), within the selected namespace. This metric helps monitor database performance and pinpoint slow or failing operations.
panels.title: DB Operation Duration by Operation

title: Backstage / Telemetry / Namespace
